definition: to assert/to insist that
to bite/to nip
variant of 咬[yao3]
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]

sentences.english: He insisted i fomenting dissent, and he said he would have to terminate me .
sentences.chinese: 他一口咬定我煽动不满，还说要解聘我。

sentences.english: He insists that Gary is the murderer.
sentences.chinese: 他一口咬定了盖瑞是凶手。

sentences.english: In short, the girl insisted that she did not know them.
sentences.chinese: 总之，姑娘一口咬定，她根本不认识他们。

sentences.english: She swore against me, saying I had stolen her purse.
sentences.chinese: 她诬告我是小偷，一口咬定我偷了她的钱包。

sentences.english: Attachment is a "Yao Ding Aoyama do not relax, he served as Seoul Old and style."
sentences.chinese: 执着是“咬定青山不放松，任尔东南西北风”。

definition: to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
to deny flatly
to own up to a fault/to admit the truth/to acknowledge a debt
to claim/to insist
reliable evidence (idiom); conclusive proof/definitive evidence
to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to accuse falsely
to reveal the truth/to spill the beans
to confess
to testify/to give evidence
lit. one-track path; fig. to adopt a unified approach to discussing an issue/to sing from the same hymn-sheet
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to quibble
determined/unshakable
